title: Rich Lister-backed software company seeks fresh funds
text:
Everyone loves chasing the next big thing – especially Rich Listers.

So it's interesting to see the names involved with e-commerce software company Marketplacer, which is in front of potential investors and brokers for a pre-initial public offering funding round this week.

Its backers include Australian fund manager Bombora Investment Management, which is leading the pitch, co-founders Jason Wyatt and Sam Salter and chairman Peter Bartels, the former CEO of Foster's Group and Coles Myer.

And then come the Rich Listers. First up is stockpicker David Paradice, whose name is on the door of $16 billion asset manager Paradice Investment Management, and property and equities investment firm Audant Investments' Robert Whyte.

There's also Jayco founder Gerry Ryan, a former Rich Lister who narrowly missed out on the 2019 edition, and Hewlett Packard pair Malcolm Wyatt (global head of sales) and Tim Stonesifer (global CFO).

The names are detailed in a pitch to potential investors, obtained by Street Talk.
description: Everyone loves chasing the next big thing – especially Rich Listers.
